meanings.definition: A person who explains or interprets something.
meanings.sent1: The expounder clarified the complex topic for the students.
meanings.sent2: The expounder at the museum guided visitors through the art exhibit.
meanings.sent3: The expounder made the boring history lesson sound like an exciting adventure.
meanings.sent4: She was a true expounder of the mysteries of the universe.
meanings.sent5: The expounder's words painted a vivid picture in the minds of the audience.

meanings.sent1: He will expounder the rules of the game to the new players.
meanings.sent2: She expounders her ideas clearly during the presentation.
meanings.sent3: The comedian tried to expounder the punchline, but it fell flat.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes expounder her emotions more than words ever could.
meanings.sent5: The teacher expoundered the concept with colorful visuals and engaging activities.
